required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Ankle Instability Return to Sport
clinical_study.official_title: Return to Sport and Functional Assessment After Surgery for Chronic Lateral Ankle Instability

lead_sponsor.agency: GCS Ramsay Santé pour l'Enseignement et la Recherche

clinical_study.source: GCS Ramsay Santé pour l'Enseignement et la Recherche

brief_summary.textblock: Real-life, observational, monocentric, prospective, longitudinal study, carried out at the European Center for Sports Rehabilitation (CERS), France.

detailed_description.textblock: The data will be collected through an electronic Case Report Form completed by the physician, and some auto-questionnaire completed by the patient.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of return to main sport at the expected level in both groups
primary_outcome.description: The main objective is to evaluate the rate of patients who returned to sport at the level before the injury, according to their evaluation, 10 months after arthroscopic stabilization according to the surgical technique used (repair by suture or reconstruction by tendon graft).

secondary_outcome.measure: Factors associated with the lack of resumption of sport at the level before the injury
secondary_outcome.description: Factors associated with the lack of resumption of sport at 10 months at the level before the injury

secondary_outcome.measure: Time taken to resume sport after arthroscopic stabilization
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the time taken to resume sport after arthroscopic stabilization according to the surgical technique used
Evaluate the functional state of the ankle and the level of activity of the patients during the follow-up according to the surgical technique used

arm_group.description: Patient will have an anatomical surgery of chronic lateral ankle instability under arthroscopy

intervention.description: Anatomical surgery for chronic lateral ankle instability under arthroscopy with tendon graft
Anatomical surgery for chronic lateral ankle instability under arthroscopy by suture with biological reinforcement

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated in rehabilitation at the European Sports Rehabilitation Center after anatomical surgery for chronic lateral ankle instability.
